Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: National Integrity Life Insurance Company agreed to pay a $240,000 civil monetary penalty for violations of New York Insurance Regulations that govern practices for replacing deferred annuity contracts with immediate annuity contracts.  In addition, National Integrity agreed to make restitution to individual consumers affected by its former replacement practices.
Agency: New York Department of Financial Services
Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner
Info Source: GERBER LIFE PAID $150,000 FINE FOR ILLEGALLY RAISING RATES, BestWire, April 20, 2000 (via Nexis).

Company: Western and Southern Life Insurance Company
Description: Western and Southern Life agreed to pay a $400,000 penalty and $2 million in enhanced benefits to resolve a multistate case alleging that it had in the past engaged in race-based premium practices.

Gerber Life Insurance agreed to pay $2,533,665 in restitution and a $1,102,000 civil penalty in settlement of allegations it made numerous violations of claims practices for accidental death and dismemberment policies and used an unlicensed third-party administrator.

Agency: New York Department of Financial Services
